title: Qdrant Vector Database
content:
Source: https://docs.agno.com/integrations/vectordb/qdrant/overview Learn how to use Qdrant as a vector database for your Knowledge Base Follow the instructions in the [Qdrant Setup Guide](https://qdrant.tech/documentation/guides/installation/) to install Qdrant locally. Here is a guide to get API keys: [Qdrant API Keys](https://qdrant.tech/documentation/cloud/authentication/).

Qdrant also supports asynchronous operations, enabling concurrency and leading to better performance.

Using aload() and aprint\_response() with asyncio provides non-blocking operations, making your application more responsive under load.
## Developer Resources * View [Cookbook (Sync)](https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/cookbook/knowledge/vector_db/qdrant_db/qdrant_db.py) * View [Cookbook (Async)](https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/cookbook/knowledge/vector_db/qdrant_db/async_qdrant_db.py)

code_samples.code: Qdrant also supports asynchronous operations, enabling concurrency and leading to better performance.
